data.meta_description: gpt3]Summarize this content to 100 words: pass Nia Talita Long (born October 30, 1970) is a talented American actress who rose to fame with her performances in black films. Her breakthrough role in the iconic film Boyz n the Hood (1991) marked the beginning of an illustrious career that spanned three decades. Nia Long has become a household name through her roles in hit television series such as The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air (1991-1995), Third Class (2003-2005) and Empire (2017). She has also played memorable roles in acclaimed films such as Love Jones (1997), Soul Food (1997) and The Best Man (1999) and its sequel (2013). Her ability to seamlessly switch between comedic and dramatic roles speaks volumes about her versatility as an actress. Her impressive body of work has earned her two NAACP Image Awards and a Black Reel Award. In addition to her acting career, Nia Long has dedicated her career to causes as diverse as education, health, and social justice. She is a shining example of how talent, hard work, and dedication can lead to success in the entertainment industry. American actress Nia Long Nia Long: History, Biography, Photos Wiki facts and figures Name: Nia Talita Long stage name: Nia Long Date of Birth: October 30, 1970 (53 years old) place of birth: Brooklyn, New York, USA Country of Citizenship: American high: 1.57m parents: Doughty Long, Talita Long Brothers and sisters: Sommer spouse: unmarried Boyfriend and partner: Ime Udoka (2015-2022), Masai Z. Dorsey (2001), Omarion (2023), Kevin Phillips (2008), Cuttino Mobley (2006-2009), Dwight Freeney (2006), T.I. (2005-2006), 50 Cent, Ricky Fant, Peter A. Thomas (1996-1998), Chris Webber (1993-1995) Children: Marseille Zhivago Dorsey II, Kez Sunday Udoka Profession: Actress • Television personality net worth: $9 million Early life and education Nia Long is a talented American actress, born on October 30, 1970, into a unique family in the prosperous Brooklyn borough of New York. Her parents went their separate ways before she was born, so she grew up in Trenton, New Jersey, living with her father, Dawtrey Long (a poet); her mother, Talita Long (a housewife), lived in South Los Angeles, and Talita Long was from the beautiful Caribbean island of Trinidad. Interestingly, Nia Long has another talented actress and comedian in her family, her half-sister Sommer. Her mother, a fine arts enthusiast, initially moved to Iowa City but later settled in Los Angeles after her marriage plans fell through. During her teenage years, Long moved between three different schools in Los Angeles, including Paseo del Rey Elementary School in South Los Angeles, Saint Mary's Academy in Inglewood, and Westchester High School, while pursuing a rigorous schedule of extracurricular activities, including tap, jazz and ballet classes, gymnastics, guitar, and acting. Personal life Nia Long is a versatile actress and mother of two who has had several significant relationships. She was engaged twice, once to former San Antonio Spurs assistant coach Ime Udoka from 2015 to 2022, with whom she has a son, Kez Sandy Udoka. She was also engaged to fellow actor Marseille Z. Dorsey in 2001, with whom she has a son, Marseille Zhivago Dorsey II. In addition to these dates, Nia Long has dated several famous men, including rapper and actor T.I., basketball player Chris Webber, and singer Ricky Fant. Her dating history includes relationships with actors Peter A. Thomas, 50 Cent, Kevin Phillips, and basketball players Cuttino Mobley and Dwight Freeney. Recently, Nia Long was linked to musician Omarion, and her fans are eager to see what the future holds for this potential new relationship. While she has certainly had her fair share of ups and downs in her love life, it’s undeniable that she remains a strong and resilient figure both on and off screen. Profession Nia Long’s journey into the entertainment industry began with her acting coach, Betty Bridges. She made her acting debut on “Goblin Patrol” and later landed a prominent role as Kathryn “Kat” Speakes on “Guiding Light,” a show she stayed on for three years. Her big break came on “Boyz n the Hood,” where she played Brandi, and then on “The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air,” where she played Will Smith’s girlfriend and fiancée, Beulah “Lisa” Wilkes. Interestingly, the role was originally slated for Jada Pinkett Smith, but Nia Long won the role with her talent and confidence. In 2000, Nia Long was offered the role of Alex Mundy in Charlie's Angels, but she turned it down, paving the way for Lucy Liu to take over the role. From 2003 to 2005, she played NYPD officer Sasha Monroe in Third Shift and starred in Snow Hill in 2005 and 2006. She has had a rich career on both the big and small screens, and her versatility is commendable. In the sequel, The Best Man's Holiday, released in 2013, Nia Long reprised her role, playing a character in an interracial relationship. This performance won praise from audiences and director Malcolm D. Lee. The director commented that interracial relationships may be necessary for successful African American women because they "can't always find black men who are their equal." Significantly, such relationships are not meant to be criticized or judged, and are now widely accepted in modern society. Nia Long’s talents are not limited to acting, she also directed Yolanda Adams’ music video “This Too Shall Pass”. In addition, she also won the NAACP Image Award for Best Actress in a Drama Series in 2004, proving her acting skills. She has appeared in many films, both in supporting and starring roles, co-starring with Ice Cube and Regina King, and played the role of Julianna, the owner of a Las Vegas nightclub, in the 2016 TV series “Empire”. She also voiced the character of Roberta Tubbs on The Cleveland Show, a role that was later replaced by Regan Gomez-Preston.Nia Long's extensive experience in the entertainment industry has earned her several honors, including two NAACP Image Awards and a Vinyl Award. net worth Nia Long is a talented American actress who has a successful acting career spanning over 20 years and has amassed a net worth of $9 million. Her wealth is primarily derived from her acting career. The films she starred in were all commercially successful and she also had lucrative endorsement deals with top brands. Nia Talita Long (born October 30, 1970) is a talented American actress who rose to fame with her performances in black films. Her breakthrough role in the iconic film Boyz n the Hood (1991) marked the beginning of an illustrious career that spanned three decades.

Nia Long has become a household name through her roles in hit television series such as The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air (1991-1995), Third Class (2003-2005) and Empire (2017). She has also played memorable roles in acclaimed films such as Love Jones (1997), Soul Food (1997) and The Best Man (1999) and its sequel (2013).

Her ability to seamlessly switch between comedic and dramatic roles speaks volumes about her versatility as an actress. Her impressive body of work has earned her two NAACP Image Awards and a Black Reel Award.

In addition to her acting career, Nia Long has dedicated her career to causes as diverse as education, health, and social justice. She is a shining example of how talent, hard work, and dedication can lead to success in the entertainment industry.

American actress

Early life and education

Nia Long is a talented American actress, born on October 30, 1970, into a unique family in the prosperous Brooklyn borough of New York. Her parents went their separate ways before she was born, so she grew up in Trenton, New Jersey, living with her father, Dawtrey Long (a poet); her mother, Talita Long (a housewife), lived in South Los Angeles, and Talita Long was from the beautiful Caribbean island of Trinidad.

Interestingly, Nia Long has another talented actress and comedian in her family, her half-sister Sommer. Her mother, a fine arts enthusiast, initially moved to Iowa City but later settled in Los Angeles after her marriage plans fell through.

During her teenage years, Long moved between three different schools in Los Angeles, including Paseo del Rey Elementary School in South Los Angeles, Saint Mary’s Academy in Inglewood, and Westchester High School, while pursuing a rigorous schedule of extracurricular activities, including tap, jazz and ballet classes, gymnastics, guitar, and acting.

Personal life

Nia Long is a versatile actress and mother of two who has had several significant relationships. She was engaged twice, once to former San Antonio Spurs assistant coach Ime Udoka from 2015 to 2022, with whom she has a son, Kez Sandy Udoka. She was also engaged to fellow actor Marseille Z. Dorsey in 2001, with whom she has a son, Marseille Zhivago Dorsey II.

In addition to these dates, Nia Long has dated several famous men, including rapper and actor T.I., basketball player Chris Webber, and singer Ricky Fant. Her dating history includes relationships with actors Peter A. Thomas, 50 Cent, Kevin Phillips, and basketball players Cuttino Mobley and Dwight Freeney.

Recently, Nia Long was linked to musician Omarion, and her fans are eager to see what the future holds for this potential new relationship. While she has certainly had her fair share of ups and downs in her love life, it’s undeniable that she remains a strong and resilient figure both on and off screen.

Profession

Nia Long’s journey into the entertainment industry began with her acting coach, Betty Bridges. She made her acting debut on “Goblin Patrol” and later landed a prominent role as Kathryn “Kat” Speakes on “Guiding Light,” a show she stayed on for three years. Her big break came on “Boyz n the Hood,” where she played Brandi, and then on “The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air,” where she played Will Smith’s girlfriend and fiancée, Beulah “Lisa” Wilkes. Interestingly, the role was originally slated for Jada Pinkett Smith, but Nia Long won the role with her talent and confidence.

In 2000, Nia Long was offered the role of Alex Mundy in Charlie’s Angels, but she turned it down, paving the way for Lucy Liu to take over the role. From 2003 to 2005, she played NYPD officer Sasha Monroe in Third Shift and starred in Snow Hill in 2005 and 2006. She has had a rich career on both the big and small screens, and her versatility is commendable.

In the sequel, The Best Man’s Holiday, released in 2013, Nia Long reprised her role, playing a character in an interracial relationship. This performance won praise from audiences and director Malcolm D. Lee. The director commented that interracial relationships may be necessary for successful African American women because they “can’t always find black men who are their equal.” Significantly, such relationships are not meant to be criticized or judged, and are now widely accepted in modern society.

Nia Long’s talents are not limited to acting, she also directed Yolanda Adams’ music video “This Too Shall Pass”. In addition, she also won the NAACP Image Award for Best Actress in a Drama Series in 2004, proving her acting skills. She has appeared in many films, both in supporting and starring roles, co-starring with Ice Cube and Regina King, and played the role of Julianna, the owner of a Las Vegas nightclub, in the 2016 TV series “Empire”.

She also voiced the character of Roberta Tubbs on The Cleveland Show, a role that was later replaced by Regan Gomez-Preston.Nia Long’s extensive experience in the entertainment industry has earned her several honors, including two NAACP Image Awards and a Vinyl Award.

net worth

Nia Long is a talented American actress who has a successful acting career spanning over 20 years and has amassed a net worth of $9 million. Her wealth is primarily derived from her acting career.

The films she starred in were all commercially successful and she also had lucrative endorsement deals with top brands.
